greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of (s(0), s(1), ..., s(2n)) such that 0 < s(i) < 9 and |s(i) - s(i-1)| = 1 for i = 1,2,....,2n, s(0) = 1, s(2n) = 3.
comment: In general a(n)= (2/m)*Sum(r,1,m-1,Sin(r*j*Pi/m)Sin(r*k*Pi/m)(2Cos(r*Pi/m))^(2n)) counts (s(0), s(1), ..., s(2n)) such that 0 < s(i) < m and |s(i)-s(i-1)| = 1 for i = 1,2,....,2n, s(0) = j, s(2n) = k.
link: Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (6,-9,1).
results.author: _Herbert Kociemba_, Jun 13 2004
